info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued August 11 at 4:27PM MDT until August 11 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE GRIZZLY CREEK FIRE BURN AREA IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Grizzly Creek Fire Burn Area. * WHERE...Grizzly Creek Burn Scar including Glenwood Canyon. * WHEN...Until 10 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Grizzly Creek Fire Burn Area is possible up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Grizzly Creek Fire Burn Area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are monitoring the potential for heavy rainfall over the Grizzly Creek Fire Burn Area, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
